questions.question_text: "autonomy" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: The ability to make decisions independently
questions.example_sentence: The new policy gives employees greater autonomy in managing their work schedules.
questions.explanation:
自主性・自律性
厳格な管理
業務削減
固定勤務

questions.question_text: "core" の意味はどれでしょう？
questions.example_sentence: All employees must be available during core working hours.
questions.explanation:
中核となる・主要な
任意の
一時的な
業務無関係

questions.question_text: "eligibility" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: The state of being qualified or allowed
questions.example_sentence: Employees should confirm their eligibility for flexible schedules with their managers.
questions.explanation:
適格性・資格
業績低下
非公式合意
福利厚生

questions.question_text: "constraint" の意味はどれでしょう？
questions.example_sentence: Operational constraints may limit who can participate in the program.
questions.explanation:
制約・制限
報奨
評価
希望

questions.question_text: "accountability" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: Responsibility for one’s actions and outcomes
questions.example_sentence: Managers emphasized accountability under the flexible work policy.
questions.explanation:
責任・説明責任
監督不要
勤怠管理
雇用契約
